oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NUMERICALLY MODELING PERSONNEL DANGER ON A PROMENADE BREAKWATER DUE TO OVERTOPPING WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Endoh, Kimihiko
Takahashi, Shigeo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: numerical modeling
personnel dange
breakwater
Pomenade breakwater
overtopping
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Prototype experiments were carried out to quantify when personnel on top of a promenade breakwater will lose their balance due to overtopping waves. The danger of being carried out into the sea was also investigated using model experiments. Based on our results, we developed an empirical formula for calculating the wave height at which personnel danger occurs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
